description.narrative: The Support For Reform project provides a flexible pool of funding to allow AusAID to fund low-cost activities in support of reform in Burma. The rapidly changing Burma country context has resulted in a range of new opportunities for activities that support reforms in Burma but do not fall within the scope of AusAID's major sectoral programs, and for which no other funding mechanisms are readily available. This includes activities proposed by International Financial Institutions which are scaling up aid programs in Burma, Australian universities, and other partners. The total value of this initiative is $0.7 million over 2 years, starting 2012-13.
